channel.title: [PI] Loyalty Titles [PI]

item.title: [PI] Loyalty Titles [PI]
item.dc:creator: @david7147 david7147
item.description:
@david7147 wrote:

4l4q6q.png1284×520

This is quite weird… When one player talks, it shows his name and rank and crown on HIS screen, but when the OTHER player sees it, it shows as THAT players name rank and title.

David talks: CROWN Owner David
Satan sees it as: Crown Donator Satan

ALSO, when you right click on the chat box, you get the <col=13132800>DonatorSatan

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

I followed this tutorial

At first, when you talked, everything was perfect, but I started messing with the code again, in my client.java

if(j2 == 5)
							pushMessage(s, 1, "@cr4@" + "<col=13132800>"+getRank(myPlayer.skill)+"</col>" + myPlayer.name);
						if(j2 == 4)
							pushMessage(s, 1, "@cr0@" + "<col=13132800>"+getRank(myPlayer.skill)+"</col>" + myPlayer.name);
						else if(j2 == 3)
							pushMessage(s, 1, "@cr2@" + "<col=13132800>"+getRank(myPlayer.skill)+"</col>" + myPlayer.name);
						else if(j2 == 2)
							pushMessage(s, 1, "@cr2@" + "<col=13132800>"+getRank(myPlayer.skill)+"</col>" + myPlayer.name);
						else if (j2 == 1)
                            pushMessage(s, 1, "@cr1@" + "<col=13132800>"+getRank(myPlayer.skill)+"</col>" + myPlayer.name); 
						else
							pushMessage(s, 2, "@or2@" + "<col=13132800>"+getRank(myPlayer.skill)+"</col>" + myPlayer.name);
					}
					catch(Exception exception)
					{
						signlink.reporterror("cde2");
					}
			}
			stream.currentOffset = k3 + j3;
		}

Read full topic
